source_sentence: Dhono diṭṭhaṁ na maññati, diṭṭhasmiṁ na maññati, diṭṭhato na maññati, diṭṭhā meti na maññati;
translation: But they don’t identify with what is seen, they don’t identify in what is seen, they don’t identify regarding what is seen, they don’t identify as what is seen;

source_sentence: sutaṁ na maññati, sutasmiṁ na maññati, sutato na maññati, sutaṁ meti na maññati;
translation: They don’t identify with the heard ...

source_sentence: mutaṁ na maññati, mutasmiṁ na maññati, mutato na maññati, mutaṁ meti na maññati;
translation: They don’t identify with the thought ...

source_sentence: viññātaṁ na maññati, viññātasmiṁ na maññati, viññātato na maññati, viññātaṁ meti na maññati.
translation: They don’t identify with the known ...
For this was said by the Buddha,

source_sentence: “asmīti, bhikkhave, maññitametaṁ, ayamahamasmīti maññitametaṁ, bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, na bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, rūpī bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, arūpī bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, saññī bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, asaññī bhavissanti maññitametaṁ, nevasaññīnāsaññī bhavissanti maññitametaṁ.
translation: “Mendicants, ‘I am’, ‘I am what is not’, ‘I am this’, ‘I will be’, ‘I will not be’, ‘I will have form’, ‘I will be formless’, ‘I will be percipient’, ‘I will be non-percipient’, ‘I will be neither percipient nor non-percipient.

source_sentence: Maññitaṁ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṁ gaṇḍo, maññitaṁ sallaṁ, maññitaṁ upaddavo.
translation: Conceit is a disease, a boil, a dart. The dart with poison, the dart.

source_sentence: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmāti, evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti—
translation: So mendicants, you should train yourselves like this: ‘We will live with a heart free of vanity.’”

source_sentence: dhono na hi tena maññati yadidaṁ diṭṭhasutaṁ mutesu vā.
translation: There is no oppressed because of what is seen that is,
He doesn’t think of purity,

source_sentence: Dhono aññena asuddhimaggena micchāpaṭipadāya aniyyānikapathena aññatra satipaṭṭhānehi aññatra sammappadhānehi aññatra iddhipādehi aññatra indriyehi aññatra balehi aññatra bojjhaṅgehi aññatra ariyā aṭṭhaṅgikā maggā suddhiṁ visuddhiṁ parisuddhiṁ muttiṁ vimuttiṁ parimuttiṁ na icchati na sādiyati na pattheti na piheti nābhijappatīti—
translation: Entering with unpurified purity or path to purity of mindfulness, except for the sake of the noble eightfold path, he doesn’t go anywhere else than the pure spiritual path. He doesn’t consent to the noble eightfold path. He doesn’t consent to the noble eightfold path.
is seeking purity by means of purity.
There is no desire for pleasure,

source_sentence: Sabbe bālaputhujjanā rajjanti, puthujjanakalyāṇakaṁ upādāya satta sekkhā virajjanti;
translation: All the foolish ordinary persons, having made the throne of the seventh announcements, in the seventh winner of the seventh.
he neither loves nor delights,

source_sentence: Viratto so khayā rāgassa vītarāgattā, khayā dosassa vītadosattā, khayā mohassa vītamohattā.
translation: Because they’re free of greed, hate, and delusion with the end of greed, hate, and delusion.

source_sentence: So vuṭṭhavāso ciṇṇacaraṇo …pe… jātijarāmaraṇasaṁsāro, natthi tassa punabbhavoti—
translation: Because of this he relishes rebirth ...

source_sentence: na hi so rajjati no virajjati.
translation: There is no desire for pleasure,
The Buddha replied,
For a beget do not identify with that,
that is to say: be seen or heard;
is seeking purity by means of purity.

source_sentence: Na hi so rajjati no virajjatī”ti.
translation: There is no desire for pleasure, not disagreeable.”
The sixth
